p: J. Meng et al. report a potential use of a traditional Tibetan medicine, Rheum tanguticum ( Rt), for treatment in Alzheimer's disease. Rt has anti-inflammatory and antioxidative properties and inhibits the expression and production of inflammatory and oxidative molecules such as IL-1 β, TNF- α, and nitric oxide by microglia. They further found that aloe-emodin and (+)-catechin are responsible for these properties through the secretion of IL-10 from microglia.
